title: rustc panic when using format! incorrectly in fold

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried to print out vec of tuples as hex string. `let v = vec![(0, 1), (0, 2)];` would have printed out as `(00, 01), (00, 02)`. ### Code https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=2770538ab32b24cf531f31419ea6bb02 ``` fn main() { let v = vec![(0, 1), (0, 2)]; let m = v.iter().fold("", |acc, (id, msg)| acc + format!("({:02X}, {:02X}), ", id, msg)); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.41.0 (5e1a79984 2020-01-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 5e1a799842ba6ed4a57e91f7ab9435947482f7d8 commit-date: 2020-01-27 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.41.0 LLVM version: 9.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: DistinctSources(DistinctSources { begin: (Real("src/main.rs"), BytePos(0)), end: (Macros("::alloc::macros::format"), BytePos(8496805)) })', src/libcore/result.rs:1188:5 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.41.0 (5e1a79984 2020-01-27) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden error: could not compile `crash`. To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: DistinctSources(DistinctSources { begin: (Real("src/main.rs"), BytePos(0)), end: (Macros("::alloc::macros::format"), BytePos(8496805)) })', src/libcore/result.rs:1188:5 stack backtrace: 0: ::fmt 1: core::fmt::write 2: std::io::Write::write_fmt 3: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} 4: #0 [typeck_tables_of] processing `main` #1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `crash`. To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
